metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3492 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL 5.5.51 and earlier, 5.6.32 andearlier, and 5.7.14 and earlier allows remote authenticated users to affectavailability via vectors related to Server: Optimizer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3492` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-client - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-server - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.7.15-0ubuntu2').
